DataElement.preferredName: Eicosapentaenoic Acid Food Frequency QuestionnaireTotal Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Total numeric score for the EPA Food Frequency Questionnaire survey for measuring food and outcomes from the patient's point of view. Measures 7 questions to yield a total score.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An essential, polyunsaturated, 20-carbon omega-3 fatty acid with anti-inflammatory and potential antineoplastic and chemopreventive activities. Eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA) may activate caspase 3, resulting in apoptosis in susceptible tumor cell populations. In addition, this agent may inhibit cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2), resulting in inhibition of prostaglandin synthesis and prostaglandin-mediated inflammatory processes._A group of substances which are consumed by humans and animals._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. (NCI)_A predetermined set of questions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An essential, polyunsaturated, 20-carbon omega-3 fatty acid with anti-inflammatory and potential antineoplastic and chemopreventive activities. Eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA) may activate caspase 3, resulting in apoptosis in susceptible tumor cell populations. In addition, this agent may inhibit cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2), resulting in inhibition of prostaglandin synthesis and prostaglandin-mediated inflammatory processes.

Concepts.definition: An essential, polyunsaturated, 20-carbon omega-3 fatty acid with anti-inflammatory and potential antineoplastic and chemopreventive activities. Eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA) may activate caspase 3, resulting in apoptosis in susceptible tumor cell populations. In addition, this agent may inhibit cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2), resulting in inhibition of prostaglandin synthesis and prostaglandin-mediated inflammatory processes.

Property.preferredDefinition: A group of substances which are consumed by humans and animals.:The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. (NCI):Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.

Concepts.definition: A group of materials of either plant, animal or artificial origin containing essential body nutrients that can be ingested by an organism to produce energy, stimulate growth, and maintain life.
The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric score on a psychometric questionnaire or survey.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Assessment of psychological variables by the application of mathematical procedures.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The science of measuring "psychological" aspects of a person such as knowledge, skills, abilities, or personality. Measurement of these unobservable phenomena is difficult and much of the research and accumulated art of this discipline is designed to reliably define and then quantify.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
